hero.title: Heal, Restore and Thrive
hero.subtitle: We remodel your boundaries and success
hero.description: Professional psychological services, cognitive assessments, diagnosis, and counseling in a warm, open, and non-judgmental environment.

philosophy.title: I Believe Your Mental Health Matters
philosophy.description: Often, our lives are complicated, and the same goes for our problems. Psychotherapy is the process of identifying and defining the problem you are experiencing and finding new ways to approach it.

compassionate.title: Compassionate Care
compassionate.description: Fresh approaches to mental health care in a warm, open and non-judgmental environment, to help reduce emotional suffering and behavioral concerns.

evidenceBased.title: Evidence-Based Methods
evidenceBased.description: Utilizing well-researched evidence-based and talk-based psychological techniques including CBT, DBT, ACT, EMDR, and more.

personalized.title: Personalized Approach
personalized.description: Clients receive a personalized service tailored to their specific needs, in a collaborative manner that respects your unique journey.

holistic.title: Holistic Wellbeing
holistic.description: Looking at eight distinct forms of intelligence and addressing physical, mental, emotional, and social health factors.

disorders.title: Disorders We Treat
disorders.subtitle: Comprehensive treatment for a wide range of mental health concerns

therapies.title: Evidence-Based Therapies
therapies.subtitle: We use the techniques of CBT, DBT, ACT, ST, SFT, PPT, ITP, NLP, and EMDR for therapies

cbt.title: Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT)
cbt.description: Combat present-time issues through problem-solving and identifying unhelpful thought patterns.

dbt.title: Dialectical Behavioural Therapy (DBT)
dbt.description: A modified version of CBT that brings together acceptance and change for optimal results.

act.title: Acceptance & Commitment Therapy (ACT)
act.description: Mindfulness-based approach that teaches acceptance of emotions while committing to positive action.

emdr.title: EMDR Therapy
emdr.description: Eye Movement Desensitization Reprocessing for healing from trauma and emotional distress.

schema.title: Schema Therapy
schema.description: Unified approach combining cognitive, behavioral, and gestalt therapy methods.

mindfulness.title: Mindfulness
mindfulness.description: Practices to become aware of thoughts and emotions without judgment or distraction.

cta.title: Ready to Begin Your Journey?
cta.description: Take the first step towards emotional growth and meaningful change. Contact us today for a consultation.

footer.copyright: Â© 2025 Raluca Diana Tocoian. All rights reserved.

hero.title: Get in Touch
hero.subtitle: Ready to take the first step? Contact us to schedule a consultation or ask any questions you may have.

form.title: Send a Message
form.messagePlaceholder: Tell us about what brings you here and how we can help...
form.privacy: I understand that this form is not for emergencies. If you are in crisis, please call 911 or go to your nearest emergency room.
form.responseNote: We will respond to your inquiry within 24-48 hours

q1.question: How do I schedule an appointment?
q1.answer: You can schedule an appointment by calling us at +1 (212) 255-5511, sending an email, or filling out the contact form above. We will respond within 24-48 hours to discuss availability and answer any questions.

q2.question: Do you offer online therapy?
q2.answer: Yes, we offer secure online therapy sessions via video conferencing. This provides flexibility and convenience while maintaining the same quality of care as in-person sessions.

q3.question: What should I expect in the first session?
q3.answer: The first session is an opportunity to get to know each other, discuss what brings you to therapy, review your history, and collaboratively develop treatment goals. It's a safe space to ask questions and determine if we're a good fit.

hero.title: Group Therapy Programs
hero.subtitle: Connect with others facing similar challenges in a supportive, structured environment. Our group therapy programs provide professional guidance while fostering peer support and shared learning.

sharedExperience.title: Shared Experience
sharedExperience.description: Realize you're not alone in your struggles. Connect with others who understand what you're going through.

peerSupport.title: Peer Support
peerSupport.description: Give and receive support from group members, building meaningful connections and learning from others' perspectives.

skillPractice.title: Skill Practice
skillPractice.description: Practice new skills in a safe environment with immediate feedback and support from both therapist and peers.

costEffective.title: Cost-Effective
costEffective.description: Group therapy is typically more affordable than individual therapy while still providing professional guidance and support.

dbt.title: DBT Skills Group
dbt.description: Learn the four core modules of Dialectical Behavior Therapy: mindfulness, distress tolerance, emotion regulation, and interpersonal effectiveness. Ideal for those struggling with emotional dysregulation, impulsivity, or relationship difficulties.
dbt.scheduleValue: Most groups begin at scheduled intervals throughout the year.

cta.title: Ready to Join a Group?
cta.description: Experience the power of connection and shared healing. Contact us today to learn more about our group programs and find the right fit for you.

AnxietyPage.title: Anxiety Disorders Treatment
AnxietyPage.subtitle: Anxiety is a normal human emotion, but when it becomes overwhelming and interferes with daily life, it may be time to seek professional help. We provide evidence-based treatment to help you manage and overcome anxiety.

understanding.title: Understanding Anxiety
understanding.description1: Anxiety disorders are among the most common mental health conditions, affecting millions of people worldwide. They can manifest in various forms, including generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), social anxiety, panic disorder, and specific phobias.
understanding.description2: Common symptoms include excessive worry, restlessness, difficulty concentrating, muscle tension, sleep disturbances, and physical symptoms such as rapid heartbeat, sweating, and trembling.

DepressionPage.title: Depression Treatment
DepressionPage.subtitle: Depression is more than just feeling sad. It's a serious mental health condition that affects how you feel, think, and handle daily activities. With professional support, recovery is possible.

understanding.title: Understanding Depression
understanding.description1: Depression can manifest in various forms, including major depressive disorder, persistent depressive disorder, and seasonal affective disorder. It affects people of all ages and backgrounds.
understanding.description2: Common symptoms include persistent sadness, loss of interest in activities, changes in appetite or sleep, fatigue, difficulty concentrating, feelings of worthlessness, and thoughts of death or suicide.

TraumaPTSDPage.title: Trauma & PTSD Treatment
TraumaPTSDPage.subtitle: Trauma can have lasting effects on your mental and emotional wellbeing. We provide specialized, trauma-informed care to help you process difficult experiences and reclaim your life.

understanding.title: Understanding Trauma & PTSD
understanding.description1: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) can develop after experiencing or witnessing a traumatic event. Trauma can result from various experiences including accidents, violence, abuse, natural disasters, or other life-threatening situations.
understanding.description2: Common symptoms include intrusive memories, flashbacks, nightmares, avoidance of reminders, negative changes in thoughts and mood, and heightened reactivity such as being easily startled or feeling on edge.

StressPage.title: Stress Management
StressPage.subtitle: While stress is a normal part of life, chronic stress can impact your health, relationships, and quality of life. Learn effective strategies to manage stress and build resilience.

understanding.title: Understanding Stress
understanding.description: Stress is the body's response to challenges or demands. While short-term stress can be motivating, chronic stress can lead to physical health problems, mental health issues, and decreased quality of life.

mindfulness.title: Mindfulness & Relaxation
mindfulness.description: Learn techniques for calming the nervous system and creating moments of peace in your daily life.

cognitive.title: Cognitive Restructuring
cognitive.description: Identify and change stress-inducing thought patterns, developing more balanced and helpful ways of thinking.

timeManagement.title: Time Management
timeManagement.description: Develop effective strategies for prioritizing tasks, setting boundaries, and creating a sustainable work-life balance.

lifestyle.title: Lifestyle Optimization
lifestyle.description: Address sleep, exercise, nutrition, and social connection to build a strong foundation for stress resilience.

RelationshipsPage.title: Relationship Issues
RelationshipsPage.subtitle: Healthy relationships require effort, communication, and sometimes professional support. We help individuals and couples build stronger, more fulfilling connections.

understanding.title: Understanding Relationship Challenges
understanding.description: Relationship difficulties can arise from communication problems, trust issues, life transitions, differing expectations, or unresolved conflicts. These challenges are normal and can be addressed with the right support.

communication.title: Communication Skills
communication.description: Learn effective techniques for expressing needs, active listening, and understanding your partner's perspective.

conflict.title: Conflict Resolution
conflict.description: Develop healthy strategies for managing disagreements, finding compromise, and resolving conflicts constructively.

attachment.title: Attachment Patterns
attachment.description: Understand how your attachment style affects relationships and develop more secure, healthy connection patterns.

boundaries.title: Boundary Setting
boundaries.description: Learn to establish and maintain healthy boundaries that protect your wellbeing while fostering intimacy and connection.

PerinatalMoodPage.title: Perinatal Mood Disorders
PerinatalMoodPage.subtitle: Pregnancy and the postpartum period can bring unexpected emotional challenges. You're not alone, and help is available for perinatal depression, anxiety, and related conditions.

understanding.title: Understanding Perinatal Mood Disorders
understanding.description1: Perinatal mood disorders include depression and anxiety that occur during pregnancy or in the first year after childbirth. These conditions are common, affecting up to 1 in 5 new mothers, and are highly treatable.
understanding.description2: Symptoms may include persistent sadness, excessive worry, difficulty bonding with baby, intrusive thoughts, changes in sleep or appetite, and feelings of guilt or inadequacy.

specialized.title: Specialized Perinatal Therapy
specialized.description: Evidence-based treatment specifically designed for the unique challenges of pregnancy and new motherhood.

cbt.title: CBT for Perinatal Mood
cbt.description: Address negative thoughts and develop coping strategies tailored to the perinatal period.

bonding.title: Mother-Infant Bonding Support
bonding.description: Guidance and support in developing a secure attachment with your baby despite mood challenges.

partner.title: Partner Support
partner.description: Involving partners in treatment to build understanding and create a supportive home environment.

cta.title: You Deserve Support
cta.description: Perinatal mood disorders are treatable. With professional support, you can feel better and enjoy this special time with your baby.

SelfEsteemPage.title: Self-Esteem Issues
SelfEsteemPage.subtitle: Low self-esteem can affect every area of your life. Learn to develop a healthier, more compassionate relationship with yourself.

understanding.title: Understanding Self-Esteem
understanding.description: Self-esteem is how we value and perceive ourselves. Low self-esteem can stem from childhood experiences, trauma, criticism, or negative self-talk, impacting relationships, career, and overall wellbeing.

GriefLossPage.title: Grief & Loss
GriefLossPage.subtitle: Grief is a natural response to loss. We provide compassionate support to help you navigate the grieving process and find meaning after loss.

understanding.title: Understanding Grief
understanding.description: Grief can result from the death of a loved one, divorce, job loss, or other significant life changes. Everyone grieves differently, and there is no "right" way to grieve.

AddictionPage.title: Addiction Treatment
AddictionPage.subtitle: Addiction is a complex condition that affects the brain and behavior. With professional support, recovery is possible.

understanding.title: Understanding Addiction
understanding.description: Addiction involves compulsive use of substances or behaviors despite harmful consequences. It affects brain chemistry, decision-making, and can impact every area of life.

ADHDPage.title: ADHD Treatment
ADHDPage.subtitle: ADHD affects focus, impulse control, and organization. Learn strategies to manage symptoms and thrive in work, relationships, and daily life.

understanding.title: Understanding ADHD
understanding.description: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) is a neurodevelopmental condition characterized by inattention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity. It affects both children and adults.

PersonalityDisordersPage.title: Personality Disorders
PersonalityDisordersPage.subtitle: Personality disorders involve enduring patterns of thinking and behavior that cause distress. Specialized therapy can lead to meaningful change.

understanding.title: Understanding Personality Disorders
understanding.description: Personality disorders are characterized by inflexible patterns of thinking, feeling, and behaving that differ significantly from cultural expectations and cause distress or impairment.

SexualDysfunctionsPage.title: Sexual Dysfunctions
SexualDysfunctionsPage.subtitle: Sexual health is an important part of overall wellbeing. We provide compassionate, evidence-based treatment for sexual concerns.

understanding.title: Understanding Sexual Dysfunctions
understanding.description: Sexual dysfunctions can include difficulties with desire, arousal, orgasm, or pain during sexual activity. These issues are common and often treatable.

EatingDisordersPage.title: Eating Disorders
EatingDisordersPage.subtitle: Eating disorders are serious mental health conditions that require specialized treatment. Recovery is possible with the right support.

understanding.title: Understanding Eating Disorders
understanding.description: Eating disorders involve disturbed eating patterns and intense concerns about weight and shape. They include anorexia nervosa, bulimia nervosa, binge eating disorder, and others.

BipolarPage.title: Bipolar Disorder
BipolarPage.subtitle: Bipolar disorder involves extreme mood swings. With proper treatment and support, people with bipolar disorder can lead fulfilling lives.

understanding.title: Understanding Bipolar Disorder
understanding.description: Bipolar disorder is characterized by episodes of mania or hypomania alternating with episodes of depression. These mood episodes significantly impact energy, activity, and functioning.

MensMentalHealthPage.title: Men's Mental Health
MensMentalHealthPage.subtitle: Men face unique mental health challenges and often hesitate to seek help. We provide a supportive environment for men to address their mental health needs.

understanding.title: Understanding Men's Mental Health
understanding.description: Men may experience depression, anxiety, and other mental health conditions differently than women. Social expectations about masculinity can make it difficult for men to seek help.

tailored.title: Male-Focused Therapy
tailored.description: Treatment approaches that acknowledge and address the unique experiences and challenges faced by men.

stress.title: Stress Management
stress.description: Practical strategies for managing work stress, financial pressure, and other common male stressors.

anger.title: Anger Management
anger.description: Learn to understand and express anger in healthy ways, improving relationships and emotional regulation.

relationships.title: Relationship & Communication Skills
relationships.description: Develop skills for emotional expression, vulnerability, and building stronger connections with partners and family.

cta.title: Strength Includes Seeking Help
cta.description: Taking care of your mental health is a sign of strength, not weakness. Contact us today to get the support you deserve.

AttachmentDisorderPage.title: Attachment Disorder Treatment
AttachmentDisorderPage.subtitle: Attachment difficulties can affect your ability to form and maintain healthy relationships. We help you understand your attachment patterns and develop more secure connections.

understanding.title: Understanding Attachment Disorders
understanding.description: Attachment patterns develop in early childhood and influence how we relate to others throughout life. Insecure attachment styles (anxious, avoidant, or disorganized) can lead to difficulties in relationships, emotional regulation, and self-esteem.

attachmentBased.title: Attachment-Based Therapy
attachmentBased.description: Explore early attachment experiences and their impact on current relationships, working toward more secure patterns.

schema.title: Schema Therapy
schema.description: Address core emotional needs and maladaptive patterns that developed from early attachment disruptions.

eft.title: Emotionally Focused Therapy
eft.description: Strengthen emotional bonds and create secure attachment in current relationships through structured interventions.

mbt.title: Mentalization-Based Therapy
mbt.description: Improve ability to understand your own and others' mental states, enhancing relationship quality and security.

CBTPage.title: Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT)
CBTPage.subtitle: CBT is an evidence-based approach that helps you identify and change unhelpful thought patterns and behaviors. It's practical, goal-oriented, and effective for many mental health conditions.

what.title: What is CBT?
what.description: Cognitive Behavioural Therapy is based on the concept that our thoughts, feelings, and behaviors are interconnected. By changing negative thought patterns, we can change how we feel and behave.

cognitive.title: Cognitive Restructuring
cognitive.description: Learn to identify and challenge negative thought patterns, replacing them with more balanced and helpful perspectives.

behavioral.title: Behavioral Activation
behavioral.description: Engage in activities that improve mood and break cycles of avoidance and withdrawal.

exposure.title: Exposure Therapy
exposure.description: Gradually face feared situations or thoughts in a controlled, supportive environment to reduce anxiety.

skills.title: Coping Skills Training
skills.description: Develop practical techniques for managing stress, anxiety, and difficult emotions in daily life.

cta.title: Start Your CBT Journey
cta.description: Contact us today to begin developing practical skills for lasting change.

DBTPage.title: Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT)
DBTPage.subtitle: DBT combines mindfulness, distress tolerance, emotion regulation, and interpersonal effectiveness skills. It's especially helpful for emotional dysregulation and intense emotions.

what.title: What is DBT?
what.description: Dialectical Behavior Therapy is a modified form of CBT that emphasizes the balance between acceptance and change. It teaches skills for managing intense emotions and improving relationships.

mindfulness.title: Mindfulness
mindfulness.description: Learn to be present in the moment, observe without judgment, and participate effectively in life.

distress.title: Distress Tolerance
distress.description: Develop skills for surviving crises and accepting reality without making things worse.

emotion.title: Emotion Regulation
emotion.description: Understand and manage intense emotions, reduce emotional vulnerability, and increase positive experiences.

interpersonal.title: Interpersonal Effectiveness
interpersonal.description: Develop skills for asking for what you need, saying no, and managing conflict while maintaining self-respect and relationships.

expect.title: What to Expect in DBT
items: Individual therapy sessions focused on your specific goals and challenges
Skills training in the four core modules
Learning practical techniques you can use in daily life
Phone coaching for support between sessions (when needed)
Homework assignments to practice new skills
Commitment to treatment and willingness to work on change

cta.title: Build a Life Worth Living
cta.description: Learn powerful skills for managing emotions and improving relationships. Contact us today to begin your DBT journey.

ACTPage.title: Acceptance & Commitment Therapy (ACT)
ACTPage.subtitle: ACT teaches psychological flexibility through acceptance, mindfulness, and values-based action. Learn to embrace your thoughts and feelings while moving toward what matters most.

what.title: What is ACT?
what.description: Acceptance and Commitment Therapy helps you accept what's out of your control and commit to actions that enrich your life based on your personal values.

acceptance.title: Acceptance
acceptance.description: Make room for difficult feelings, sensations, and urges rather than fighting them.

defusion.title: Cognitive Defusion
defusion.description: Learn to observe thoughts without being dominated by them.

present.title: Contact with Present Moment
present.description: Develop awareness and connection with the here-and-now experience.

self.title: Self-as-Context
self.description: Access a transcendent sense of self beyond your thoughts and feelings.

values.title: Values Clarification
values.description: Identify what truly matters to you and what you want your life to stand for.

action.title: Committed Action
action.description: Take effective action guided by your values, even in the presence of difficult thoughts and feelings.

cta.title: Live a Values-Driven Life
cta.description: Discover what truly matters to you and start living accordingly. Contact us today to begin your ACT journey.

SchemaTherapyPage.title: Schema Therapy
SchemaTherapyPage.subtitle: Schema Therapy addresses deep-rooted patterns formed in childhood. It's particularly effective for personality disorders and chronic, treatment-resistant conditions.

what.title: What is Schema Therapy?
what.description: Schema Therapy integrates cognitive, behavioral, and emotion-focused techniques to identify and change lifelong patterns (schemas) that cause distress.

schemas.title: Schema Identification
schemas.description: Recognize maladaptive patterns formed in childhood that continue to affect your life.

modes.title: Mode Work
modes.description: Understand the different emotional states (modes) you shift between and learn to meet your core needs.

reparenting.title: Limited Reparenting
reparenting.description: The therapeutic relationship helps meet emotional needs that weren't met in childhood.

experiential.title: Experiential Techniques
experiential.description: Use of imagery, chair work, and other emotional techniques to access and heal childhood wounds.

expect.title: What to Expect in Schema Therapy
items: Assessment of your schemas and modes through questionnaires and discussion
Exploration of childhood experiences and unmet emotional needs
Use of imagery and experiential techniques to access emotions
Cognitive work to challenge and modify maladaptive beliefs
Behavioral pattern-breaking to develop healthier coping strategies
Longer-term treatment (typically 1-3 years) for lasting change

cta.title: Heal Deep Emotional Wounds
cta.description: Address the root causes of long-standing patterns and build lasting emotional health. Contact us today to begin Schema Therapy.

EMDRPage.title: EMDR Therapy
EMDRPage.subtitle: Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing (EMDR) is a powerful therapy for trauma and distressing memories. It helps the brain process and integrate traumatic experiences.

what.title: What is EMDR?
what.description: EMDR uses bilateral stimulation (typically eye movements) to help the brain reprocess traumatic memories, reducing their emotional impact and allowing healing to occur.

history.title: History Taking & Treatment Planning
history.description: Identify targets for treatment and develop a comprehensive treatment plan.

preparation.title: Preparation
preparation.description: Learn relaxation and coping techniques to manage distress during and between sessions.

assessment.title: Assessment
assessment.description: Identify specific memories, beliefs, emotions, and body sensations related to the target.

desensitization.title: Desensitization
desensitization.description: Process the memory using bilateral stimulation to reduce its emotional charge.

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: Strengthen positive beliefs about yourself related to the memory.

bodyScan.title: Body Scan
bodyScan.description: Check for and process any remaining physical tension or discomfort.

closure.title: Closure
closure.description: Return to a state of equilibrium and learn self-calming techniques.

reevaluation.title: Reevaluation
reevaluation.description: Review progress and identify any additional targets for treatment.

cta.title: Process Trauma and Find Peace
cta.description: EMDR can help you process traumatic memories and reclaim your life. Contact us today to begin processing traumatic memories and reclaiming your life.

MindfulnessPage.title: Mindfulness-Based Therapy
MindfulnessPage.subtitle: Mindfulness practices help you become aware of thoughts and emotions without judgment. Learn to be present and respond skillfully to life's challenges.

what.title: What is Mindfulness?
what.description: Mindfulness is the practice of paying attention to the present moment with openness, curiosity, and acceptance. It involves observing thoughts, feelings, and sensations without judgment or trying to change them.
what.therapy: Mindfulness-based therapies integrate meditation and mindfulness practices with psychological principles to help reduce stress, manage emotions, and improve overall wellbeing. These approaches have strong scientific support for various mental health conditions.

meditation.title: Meditation
meditation.description: Formal sitting practice to develop attention and awareness.

breathing.title: Breathing Exercises
breathing.description: Using the breath as an anchor to the present moment.

bodyScan.title: Body Scan
bodyScan.description: Systematic attention to physical sensations throughout the body.

informal.title: Informal Practice
informal.description: Bringing mindful awareness to everyday activities like eating, walking, or listening.

cta.title: Cultivate Present-Moment Awareness
cta.description: Learn to respond rather than react to life's challenges. Contact us today to begin your mindfulness journey.
